Mixed feelings
reviews.text: My family of four, one 16 year old, 12 year old and husband and I stayed at the Miriamar from May 8 through the 12. When we arrived we were tired and hot from the trip. We registered in and were told we had a room on the third floor. But guess what we had to walk up to our room and carry our luggage. Now if any one knows a women and a pre teen girl can bring a lot of luggage. So up we all went with all this stuff. Went into our room and to our supprise it was a room with a king. I did tell them we needed a room with double beds. Found the maid in the hall way and tried to explain to her we needed a bigger room, she spoke no english and my spanish is not the best. make a long story short we did get a room with two beds. We did notice the room did have a musty smell and the AC did not work well. The house cleaning was not at all good. The tub backed up and the maid never cleaned the bath room good. The tub had a ring around it and the beds were not made.
The view from the top floor was great, you saw the water and the kids loved it. The breakfast was ok. The front desk staff were helpful and nice.
reviews.title: Budget hotel, clean, friendly and free continental breakfast
Horrible experience Do Not Go, Find another hotel
reviews.text: I am writing this review about the Hotel Miramar, 606 Ponce de Leon Avenue, San Juan. Please DO NOT confuse this with the Marriot Miramar. I made a reservation through Priceline and received confirmation for the Hotel Miramar for one night prior to our cruise leaving. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30 am. Upon arrival a woman comes out to the street (this hotel is located on a dark side street in San Juan) and asks us if we have reservations. I thought it most peculiar, but said yes, we have reservations and confirmation (room already paid for) through Priceline. I then give her the paper with confirmation # and payment record, and she says, "We don't have a reservation for you" I said, " Here it is, it's already paid for". She says "no, I have no room for you." I said, "OK, just give us a room and we will pay for it." (thinking that I will sort all this out when we get home)

She then says, "there are no rooms available here, they are all taken." So we get back into the taxi, and our driver feels so sorry for us that he starts to call other hotels to see if he can get us a room. Meantime, we are sitting in front of the Miramar when another taxi pulls up. Two people get out and go in with their travel packet and yep.....sure enough they get a room! Meantime the taxi driver is having a difficult time since all hotel rooms are booked up in San Juan. Finally he calls the Best Western who just had an airline crew cancellation! We go there and I am telling the from desk clerk about our experirence with the Miramar Hotel and he said there were two other people who checked in earlier that the same thing had happened to. The Hotel Miramar was unsympathetic, and totally unresponsive. I would tell everyone out there, don't go.....it was an awful experience for 2 very experienced travelers. I have contacted Priceline for them to resolve this... Stay clear of this place, you don't want to end up like we did.

reviews.text: This hotel is very good we stayed there from 26 April till 01 May 2007. We had a blast the hotel staff is excellent, clean room and towels everyday. The hotel is near a supermarket on the right and right on the corner you can find taxi, and if you want to go by bus it's only 0,75$. Naxt to Pueblo Supermarket you can find, subway, a chinese restaurant, a restaurant about taco's and there's a pharmacy across the street and a beauty saloon. So we found the hotel very good. In the lobby there's free internet for 30 minutes. And a cute yellow bird. And I forgot to take a picture of the bathroom next time :-)

It is by far the worst experience at a hotel that I have ever encountered. We requested one room for a family of 4 and were given “the biggest room”. Granted, the room is relatively spacious, but none of us felt comfortable at all to really get good sleep.

reviews.text: We spent one night here as part of a Singapore Stopover. The outside appearance of the hotel is not great but once inside it's a decent hotel. OUr room was small but well equipped (even included robes) and clean. We had a view of the swimming pool and were on the 7th floor which was quiet. Breakfast was good with lots of choice and was very good value for money. Agree with comments about the staff - all very friendly and helpful and made a big fuss of our 2 young children. We weren't flying until later that night but were allowed use of a courtesy room for a shower etc before we left which was really great.

A top to bottom renovation is nearly complete at the Excelsior and it will become a Marriott Courtyard as of Feb. 1 2006 or thereabouts. Some of the things I have to say about the hotel may soon be irrelevant. But for now - a nice, moderately priced hotel for business travelers in a good location, away from the tourist hustle bustle but still convenient to the Condado and Old San Juan. I stayed in room 905 which I think is one of the best lines (ie, rooms ending in 05) - they are quite a bit larger than most other rooms, and the other large rooms are close the elevator which is pretty noisy. The room has new, fairly attractive furniture but without any bells and whistles (see pictures). It was comfortable, clean, quiet, and had a nice view of the lagoon and the Condado.
reviews.title: A hotel in progress - will soon be a Marriott Courtyard

This hotel is located about a 20 minute walk from the nearest subway stop, which is a bit further than what we were told by the hotel staff prior to our arrival. Clark’s Quay is about a 20 minute walk along the river and it is not much further to the Colonial district. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the shopping district and China town and it is possible to catch the bus for a return trip as long as you meet the bus at the same stop.

reviews.text: Booked via SingaporeAir re their Singapore stopover deals, price ok, chose hotel from second tier group in SingaporeAir list of hotels based on usual photos and proximity to the MRT train network. However the map on the hotels web site was a bit elastic with the truth re the positioning of the hotel to the nearest station which appeared to be maybe 500 metres away at most, however was around 1500 meters which is a long way in 30degree heat and high humidity. Ordered a double bed but got a twin, nice bathroom, room no better than cheaper 3* hotels. Pool nice but not enough seats and towels always running out, staff not keen to help on that one due to not getting the tips they recieve from bar sales. Pool changing rooms also filthy, hadnt been cleaned in months by the look of it. Did not eat in hotel so cant comment, probably wouldnt stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two stays at the Miramar - three nights on arrival in Singapore and one night (different room) prior to leaving. Rooms are comfy and reasonably spacious, tea and coffee facilities are good, excellent beds, helpful and charming staff and very good value food in the restaurant. The pool at the rear of the hotel is great and our first room on 9th floor overlooked this, although the pool itself is somewhat surrounded by other buildings. Nevertheless the sun is on the decks most of the day and it's a peaceful place to read and swim. Access to Chinatown MRT is about a 10 minute walk, and you can get to anywhere in the city on the MRT (underground) which is spotless, and staffed with very helpful people. Taxis are very reasonable too. It's not a luxury hotel but it would be hard to find fault and as a place to rest your head during a busy sightseeing trip to Singapore, you can't do better.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a convenient position for access around Singapore

We stayed on NYE becayse we wanted to be close to the Quay and wanted to be able to afford to eat that night. We didnt eat in the restaurant there. We contemplated it, but the ambience was so lacking in the foyer restaurant that we gave it a miss. We had a drink in the lounge and it was like something out of the 80s. Slightly depressing!

really helpful stopover
reviews.text: Stayed here for a stopover for 36 hours. The staff really couldn't have been more helpful and we really felt that we had relaxed and been

able to rest between flights. We arrived at 8.30 am and were allowed to use a hospitality room to shower and change in. When we emerged from there intending to store our luggage for the day until our room was available, we were told that our room was all ready for us which was great. The breakfast wasn't up to much and was expensive but we were tired so we ate there anyway. The shuttle bus for Singapore Stopovers stops right outside the hotel which was great. It wasn't so easy to find the stops along Orchard Rd though and we ended up getting a taxi back to the hotel. The taxis were so cheap though that I used them a few times after that. It was better than waiting for a bus in the heat when we were tired. We checked out the following morning, having enjoyed the pool, and left our luggage stored for the day. We were told we could have a late check-out anyway of 2.30 but we wanted to go sight-seeing. When we arrived back at the hotel about 6.30 pm it was possible to prepare for the flight by using the hospitality room again. The hotel was extremely good value, booked with Singapore Airways as part of their stopover service. I really felt we had excellent value for money. I was travelling with my son and could have felt vulnerable in a strange city but I felt quite safe and would go there again.

Concrete Block
reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this hotel because it was concrete inside and out. I have never stayed in a room with concrete walls, and hope never to again! The staff was nice, but the hotel is on the fringe of a very bad neighborhood and we would not have felt comfortable walking. I had thought the hotel was very close to Old San Juan from their website, but it is about a $12 cab ride away.

Thought that by picking a cheap hotel I could save a lot. Not this one. Except for a couple of staff, I've never seen rudeness so institutionalized in one place from the owner down to the support staff. The rooms are old and worn. Bathrooms are scarily decrepit with tiles chipped off. Thanks god, there is the outside and that's what I did when I was booked in this rodent's nest- stayed outside most of the time expect when it's time to sleep......and you better be really exhausted...
reviews.title: Run now while you can

reviews.text: My mother and I took a mother-daughter vacation and stayed at the Miramar for a week. It was a wonderful place to stay! The hotel was beautiful and the staff, especially Ramon, Sylvia, and Jorge (and others that I can't remember their names) were very accommodating and helpful! They gave us directions, recommendations on places to eat, and wanted to hear of our adventures daily! I loved the area that it was in as I wanted to see more of authentic Puerto Rico than the Americanized version that I felt I would've gotten at the Hilton, etc. There's a pharmacy across the street with some very reasonable souvenirs. Los Pinos Cafe, also across the street, had some wonderful Mofongo. The hotel had a very nice continental breakfast and since parking is so hard to find in San Juan the private parking was a lifesaver! The sundeck has a beautiful view! Overall, I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay!!!!!

reviews.text: While this is rated a 2 star hotel, don't let this make your decision for you. This is an older, quaint hotel. The staff there are all nice, but Ramone and Sylvia make the hotel what it is.They are some of the best front desk staff I have ever run into. I hated to leave them as much as Puerto Rico!!! They want to know your plans and are always willing to suggest something. They really just bend over backwards to help you. The rooms are large and accommadating. The parking is sparse, but if you give your keys to the front desk staff they will park it for you. (Another plus) The free continental breakfast is standard fare: cereal, sweet rolls, french bread, coffee, juice and jams. They also have free internet for you to use, which is a plus in this technology addicted world: I was able to check my email.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!!!!!

reviews.text: Paid a very low rate, as they say you get what you pay for. The hotel manager, very rude and full of himself. We arrived at 4:00pm was given the room, took the luggage to the room, opened the door, the room was not cleaned from the prior guest, I did state we arrived at 4:00pm!!!! I returned to the front desk, the young lady was apologetic and gave us a new room, she even went up and checked the room before we lugged or luggage back up to the quest rooms. The room was ok, but the ice machine is not inside a stair well or a room on its own, it is in the hallway of the quest floor, all night you can here the ice machine dropping ice into the bottom of the machines' holding area. The first shower I took, I tried to adjust the shower head and it came off in my hand, the next morning I gave the shower head to the manager, as he gave it to his maintenance person the manager rolled his eyes and asked me was their anything else broken in the room . I replied not at this time. Later that day when we return from the beach, I tried to adjust the air conditioners fan speed, but could not because that was broken. The maid service starts at 7:00am sharp, we know because the wheels on the maid service cart squeal load enough to wake you up, if that doesn't wake you the maids talking loudly, and their buckets hitting the wall, cart, ice machine, doors, will. I could continue but you get the point. I haven't had the opportunity to go to Europe yet, but if this is a European style hotel, no thanks, I'll pass.
reviews.title: You could not pay me to stay here.

reviews.title: Miramar Fine For Short Visit
reviews.text: Considering the prices of five star hotels, we decided to try this hotel for a couple of nights before going to the El San Juan Hotel & Casino. It was clean, the rooms were large, and the staff was helpful. The artwork on the walls in the rooms was actually nice, and the room included a fridge & microwave. Continental breakfast was included which came with fruit, cold cuts, cheese, cereal, coffee, rolls, etc. For two breakfasts, it was nice. They had pretty plants in the tiny lobby and a few birds and a computer in a room behind the lobby. The restaurant next door is where the breakfast was served. We also had dinner there our first night (it included a free drink) - it was pretty good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a lower-end priced hotel, this one was fine. The only negative was that the area wasn't close to much. We took the bus to Old San Juan, which was good, and we walked down the block through a few souvenir shops. Other than that, you're in the middle of no where. If you need to hang out in your room, it doesn't have the right feel to want to stay and relax. It just didn't feel that safe. (They locked their front door at night and had someone let you in). For a short stay, it's acceptable. The hotel itself had some charm. If you want to be in the heart of everything, though, this location leaves something to be desired.
reviews.title: Beware of hidden fees

likes.liked: — close to a local bus station that take you to San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked for a night after our cruise. We paid $13 from the Pan American Pier to the hotel. We arrived at 10:30 in the morning. They said that the rooms would not be available until 3 p.m. They allowed us to leave our luggages there while we explored old San Juan. There was a local bus stop located across the street on the left of the hotel. All you have to pay was $0.50/person. It took us to the main station in Old San Juan. We came back at 4:15 thinking that the room should be ready. However, they said that it wouldn't be ready in another half hour. There was not much to do around the hotel so we walked to the supermarket on the right of the hotel. We came back at 5 but the room was still not ready. The receptionist said that we have to pay an extra $3 per person and $5 per night stay. I said that I already paid all the taxes and others charges when I booked for ONE night stay. She then pointed to a sign on the top of the counter and said that the travel agency might not know about these additional charges. I looked at it and it said that the charges commenced on October 1, 2006. And now it is 2008!She insisted that we pay before we she gave us the key. I paid and I asked for a receipt and she printed one for me. The room was big but the fridge didn't work, The chair almost fell apart. The lamp was barely attached to the light fixture. There was mildew smell in the room too unless you blast up the A.C.. When we checked out the next morning, an old man asked us to pay AGAIN because he couldn't find it on the computer nor it was checked off that we paid. It was too much of a hassel to stay in this hotel. Anyway, the taxi fee to the airport was $15.
reviews.title: Our one night stay.
